events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle hitting a pole in the parking lot, resulting in significant front-end damage.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial incident description and photographs provided.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to manage all further communications and document collection regarding the auto accident.
The insurer sent an acknowledgment email to the customer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and outlining next steps.
We requested accident reports, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a police report to proceed with the investigation of the claim.
The customer submitted all requested documents including the official police report and detailed photos showing full damage.
The investigation team began reviewing evidence to verify the details of the collision and assess liability and damage extent.
Investigation concluded confirming the incident facts and that the damage is covered under the customer’s policy terms.
A settlement offer has been prepared and sent to the customer detailing the approved compensation for vehicle repairs.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the settlement offer and prompt handling of their claim.
The claim was officially approved following customer acceptance of the proposed settlement terms and compensation amount.
The payment to cover vehicle repairs was issued to the customer’s designated account without delay.
The claim file has been closed after completion of all processes and confirmation that the customer has received payment.
The claim records were archived into the company database for future reference and compliance purposes.
